captions.text: Hey Vsauce, I'm Jake and....Clever girl...
Hey Grandma, what ya do- OH! Oh no!
Oh dear. In Granny Smith you play a rollerblading, cane wielding old woman
who is chasing after the young whippersnapper who is stealing all the apples.
the game takes you across and through multiple locations and has a

really crazy physics engine that is
reminiscent of Happy Wheels.
It's almost more fun trying to create ridiculous crashes for Granny's withered old body than it is
beating a level.
But if you'd rather run off a building instead of through one get Canabalt,
a beautiful,

simple and incredibly addictive runner.
You burst through glass, jump from

building to building whilst some collapse
below you and avoid falling obstacles
all to a pretty killer soundtrack.

If you want to survive, be sure to not
fall off the edge.
In this puzzle platformer you have to roll your multicolored cube through
different geometric landscapes. You climb up and down stairs, flip switches

and generally avoid falling into the
black abyss.

The levels are constantly moving and
changing while you play making your

mission to get to the end much more
complicated.
It is like if Vsauce and Wikipedia
had a baby that you put it in your pocket. Need to factor a polynomial? DONE.

Want to find out the hexadecimal value of
the color purple and its nearest pantone

colors? DONE. Did you know that APP is
also the name of amyloid beta a4 protein,
isoform a? Neither did I but here's it's reference sequence!

Now. knowledge is infectious but not as
much as Infectonator!
In it you spread the zombie plague from city to city either slaughtering or
converting the population by strategizing where best to release it.
There are numerous upgrades for your undead army, locations to wreak havoc upon and new
zombies to unlock like ILL Kim Jong who is sadly not the rap version of Kim Jong IL.
Instead of being a monster, burn some in Scorched Monster, an 8bit
platform game where you incinerate evil with a flame thrower of destruction. You

jump from place to place exterminating
as many monster as you can before the
clock runs out.
There are also power ups like TNT and ones that extend your time. You know what's larger than 8bits?
MinePix, a really cool camera app that transforms your photos from their

normal monotony into ones that are made
out of Minecraft Blocks.

You can adjust the granularity of the
image to add more or less blocks

For even fewer pixels there's Bit.Trip Beat. In
this fun arcade style game you make
beats with every successful bounce. It plays like PONG on acid but has really

cool visuals and goes from level to
levels seamlessly.
The game can get really difficult but it gets easier if you ThinkInVisible.
A puzzle game that gives you a small peek at an objects most important feature.
It operates on a theory called gestalt psychology where your mind sees
objects as a whole before needing to see their individual parts.
What makes this game really great is that it's also available for windows phones! *Steve Ballmer screaming*
But you can make your own game in this episodes app of the week
Game Dev Story
At this point in the App world ecosystem, Game Dev Story is a classic but it is one
that I find myself playing again and again for hours at a time.
In the app you're a game developer and in being such, you also run a company.
The larger you grow the bigger the staff you can hire.
You can go to conventions,
promote your brand and be in award shows.
It is weirdly satisfying to see your fake game become a success and sell hundreds
of thousands of copies.
It becomes a fully immersive
sim game that gets you hooked into making the fake next great game
Links and prices can be found in the description below.
I'm Jake and, as always, thanks for watching.
YEAAAAH!

title: GRANNY CRASHING and more!! -- App All Knight #10
